p: Ghana is divided into ten regions which include the Greater Accra, Ashanti, Brong Ahafo, Central, Western, Volta, Upper East, and Upper West Regions. Governance takes place at the national, regional and district levels [ 20]. Bolgatanga is the regional capital as well as the administrative capital of the Upper East Region (see Figure 1). It is located within latitudes 10°30′ and 1°55′ north and longitudes 1°00′ west, with a total land area of 1620 km 2 [ 21].
